Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: 行商人
Entry.EnglishText: Peddler

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: モクラド村
Entry.EnglishText: Mocrado Village

Entry.JapaneseText: モクラド村・民家
Entry.EnglishText: Mocrado Village - Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: 民家
Entry.EnglishText: Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: どうも、こんにちは。 なんか買っていきますか？
Entry.EnglishText: Hello there. How about buying something?

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140> 道具を買う 世間話をする やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Buy Talk Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: なんか買っていきませんか？
Entry.EnglishText: How about buying something?

Entry.JapaneseText: ありがとうございます。
Entry.EnglishText: Thank you very much.

Entry.JapaneseText: キミがナイラさんの娘さん…… あの人はとても優しくて いい人だったよ……
Entry.EnglishText: You're Nayla's daughter... She was such a kind and gentle person... Really kind...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……いい人だった……
Entry.EnglishText: She was...such a nice woman...

Entry.JapaneseText: ナイラさんはとても優しくて いい人だったよ…… ……いい人だった……
Entry.EnglishText: Nayla was such a kind and gentle person... Really kind...

Entry.JapaneseText: 時々はこの村に来て、 ナイラさんの事を、 思い出してあげなよ……
Entry.EnglishText: You should stop by from time to time to visit Nayla—to keep her memory alive.

Entry.JapaneseText: この前、仕入れのために 久しぶりにノルゼンへ 行ったんだけど……
Entry.EnglishText: The other day, I went up to Nolzen for the first time in a while to stock up on supplies.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマとガジュマの関係が すごく悪くなってて ビックリしたよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I was surprised at how much the relationships between Huma and Gajuma have soured.

Entry.JapaneseText: どうなってるのかねぇ。
Entry.EnglishText: I wonder what's going to happen.

Entry.JapaneseText: この地鳴りみたいなのは 他の街でも聞こえてるのかな？
Entry.EnglishText: I wonder if that rumbling noise from the ground could be heard in the other cities?

Entry.JapaneseText: 他の街で、ヒューマと ガジュマが争ってるのを見て、 色々考えたよ……
Entry.EnglishText: I saw how Huma and Gajuma have been at odds in other cities, and I've been thinking a lot about that...

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマとガジュマの夫婦って、 もしかしたら、ひとつの理想の 関係なのかもね……
Entry.EnglishText: Perhaps marriage between a Huma and Gajuma is one way to establish an ideal relationship between us.

Entry.JapaneseText: 山を越えてはるばると この北の大地へ……
Entry.EnglishText: To think that it really exists, all the way in the Northern land across the mountains...
Entry.Notes: I added the first part of the sentence to clarify that it's connected to the second part he says

Entry.JapaneseText: 噂どおりにこんなところに 村があったから、びっくりだよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I'm surprised to find a village in a place like this. It's just how the rumors described it.

Entry.JapaneseText: それにしても…… ヒューマとガジュマの夫婦…… ねえ……
Entry.EnglishText: But still... That Huma and Gajuma couple...
Entry.Notes: May change "man" to some other term (perhaps a sigh of some sort)

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『ベッド脇の本棚』 並んでいる本はすべて詩集。 額縁には、パステル調の絵が 収められている。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Bedside Bookshelf - All the books lined up are poetry books. The picture frames display pastel paintings.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『張り紙』 「里なき者の住む村 モクラド 来る者拒まず 去る者追わず 空しき心の間隙はやがて 安らぎに満たされん」
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Poster - Mocrado, Home to the Displaced "Do not reject those who come and do not pursue those who go. Soon the void in our hearts shall be filled with peace."
Entry.Notes: May not be a poster - need to check in game (possibly a paper patch paper backing, sticker. or label) Also, not sure if there is some rhythm or poem rules that it follows

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『書きかけのノート』 「北の果て 凍てつく大地 実りなき耕野 実りなき人々 この地に到った者の心は皆、 穏やかなりし」
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Writer's Notebook - "The Northern End: The Frozen Land Fruitless fields, fruitless people Yet the hearts of all who have reached this land, they are at peace."
Entry.Notes: This may be a poem that requires a rewrite
